@ChuckBaggett The state average is an estimate only used to set up the program. The level billing amount will automatically adjust monthly as the actual bill amount replaces the state average estimates. Hope this helps. You can learn more info here: https://t.co/35nVwUoBdA (3/3)

@ChuckBaggett As each month of billing occurs, the most recent billing amount will be included in the calculation, and the oldest one will drop off. The state's average is used as part of the calculation for accounts with less than 1 year of service. (2/3)

@ChuckBaggett Thanks for reaching out, Chuck. Level billing is computed by 12 months of consecutive billing history that is averaged to arrive at the monthly payment amount. The initial amount quoted is an approximate amount, which will differ when the account bills again. (1/3)
